pr_title: [BAQE-1444] - Switch from tcp to mem H2 in jbpm-bpmn2 module

timeline.message:
[BAQE-1444] Switch from tcp to mem H2 in jbpm-bpmn2 module

- Due to this change, there might be some tests failing as records are inserted in the in memory DB much faster (some records in DB might have same date, including milliseconds).

[JBPM-9223] include case file details in case list. (#1697)

Adding new overloaded getCaseInstances method to CaseRuntimeDataService
that allows
the possibility to include case file information if a flag is set

[BAQE-1444] Switch from tcp to mem H2 in jbpm-bpmn2 module

- Due to this change, there might be some tests failing as records are inserted in the in memory DB much faster (some records in DB might have same date, including milliseconds).

- Due to this change, there might be some tests failing as records are inserted in the in memory DB much faster (some records in DB might have same date, including milliseconds).

timeline.bodyText: Comment on the line 211 no longer holds (timestamp -> UUID).
timeline.author: MarianMacik
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -211,7 +212,7 @@ public void internalTrigger(final NodeInstance from, String type) {
                 List<String> businessKeys = new ArrayList<String>();

timeline.bodyText: So I guess issue was in case there were 2 subprocesses created in a succession, for example with multi-instance/loop subprocess, right? And at least 2 of them had the same timestamp... That's really quick!
timeline.author: MarianMacik

replies.bodyText: Correct. Two parallel subprocesses from same parent created in the same millisecond... specially now having H2 pure in memory did the trick.
replies.author: afalhambra
